definitions.definition: Slippery or smooth due to a covering of liquid; often used to describe appearances.
examples: This rain is making the roads slick .
The top coating of lacquer gives this finish a slick look.
His large round head was shaved slick .
They read all kinds of slick magazines.
That new sales rep is slick . Be sure to read the fine print before you buy anything.

definitions.definition: Clever , making an apparently hard task look easy.
examples: Our new process for extracting needles from haystacks is extremely slick .
That was a slick move, locking your keys in the car.
That is one slick bicycle: it has all sorts of features!

main_definition: Slippery or smooth due to a covering of liquid; often used to describe appearances.
secondary_definitions: ( often sarcastic ) Clever , making an apparently hard task look easy.
( US , West Coast slang ) Extraordinarily great or special .
